results.title: Scorpio Rising
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Anger and Puck Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Anger Magick Lantern Cycle”.
Short films : “Kustom Kar Kommandos” (1965, 3 min): A young man strokes his customised car with a powder puff. “Pygmalion and his machine mistress.” “Puce moment (1949, 6 min): A lavishly coloured evocation of the Hollywood now gone, as shown through an afternoon in the milieu of the 1920s film star. “Scorpio rising”: A death mirror held up to American culture - Brando, bikes and black leather; Christ, chains and cocaine. A high view of the myth of the American motor cyclist. The machine as totem from toy to terror. Thanatos in chrome and black leather and bursting jeans.

results.title: Scoring: a story about date rape
results.creator_credit: Lisa Levy Stromer, Coronet and William R Sheridan
results.brief_description: Notions of what constitutes rape are explored in this documentary aimed at secondary school students. This is achieved through the story of Jimmy, a teenage boy who commits rape but can’t see it. His relationship is contrasted with a positive role model who doesn’t use coersion to get what he wants. The issues explored in the drama include; how a woman dresses, what constitues consent, what’s involved in accepting a date, and legal repurcussions.

results.title: Score
results.brief_description: Soft-pornography/erotica from director Radley Metzger resplendent with witty dialogue, telephone repairman and funky music. Older married couple Elvira and Jack like to ‘swing’ and indulge frequently in sex parties with strangers or other couples. Betsy and Eddy are younger, naive newlyweds that become the latest object of desire for Elvira and Jack and the game is on to see who will win their conquest first. Eventually, Elvira and Betsy then Jack and Eddy form up to get high and get busy. A fantasy romp that includes dressing-up, drugs and mirrors. Cast includes Claire Wilbur, Calvin Culver, Lynn Lowry, Gerald Grant, Carl Parker.

results.title: ScooterZ: basics and beyond
results.brief_description: Presented by Eric Wiley, this short program with an energetic soundtrack shows beginners and advanced riders enjoying their ScooterZ - a mode of transport originating in Asia that has taken the world by storm. Everything from young boys getting about town, Razer Pro Team Riders, Go-PED Pro Team Riders and professional rollerbladers, in line skaters and other extreme forms of “board” sports. NB: This is not an instructional video, and not all riders wear helmets and knee pads. Rather it shows the possibilities of ScooterZ and the progression from skate boards to in line skating to ScooterZ and beyond.

results.title: Scooping
results.creator_credit: N.E. Sweglar and Visual Information Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lacrosse - the Fastest Game on Two Feet”.
One of a series of films which demonstrates the skills and techniques of Lacrosse. This film looks at the techniques of scooping the ball, and shows scooping drills.

results.title: Scooby Doo
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Mosaic Media Group, Charles Roven, Richard Suckle and Raja Gosnell
results.brief_description: Two years after a clash of egos forced Mystery Inc. to close its doors, Scooby-Doo and his clever crime-solving cohorts Fred, Daphne, Shaggy and Velma are individually summoned to Spooky Island to investigate a series of paranormal incidents at the ultra-hip Spring Break hot spot. Cast includes Freddie Prinze Jr, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Matthew Lillard, Linda Cardellini, Rowan Atkinson, Miguel A. Nunez Jr, Isla Fisher.

results.title: Scoggie
results.brief_description: While most of Cape Breton’s youth leave for the excitement and opportunity of the big cities, twenty-seven-year-old Scoggie Watson remains, clinging to the things he cherishes most: the waters of Lake Bras d’Or, his hand-built sailboat, his freedom, and the friends who stayed behind. This is his story. It is a story that includes the hearty determination of some of the island people, a government scheme to develop marine farming on the Bras d’Or Lakes, and a mysterious stranger who has remained Scoggie’s hero since he was fourteen years old. Commentary by Donald Brittain.

results.title: Scientists in the Antarctic
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden, Film Workshop and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: An account of the work and living conditions of the scientists - meteorologists, zoologists and geologists - who man the seven British bases set up in the Falkland Islands Dependenices. The film also describes the annual cruise of the John Biscoe taking stores and replacements to the Dependencies. It reaches its climax with the relief of the men at Marguerite Bay who had been icebound for two years.

results.title: Scientific cook: stale tales
results.creator_credit: A Stephens Kerr Production, Channel 4 and Rowena Golman
results.brief_description: This video illustrates and discusses the answer to five scientific questions related to the principles of food preparation. 1. Why does bread go stale and what can be done to prevent this? 2. What makes a sponge cake light? 3. Why must bread dough be kneaded so much? 4. What effect does colour and texture have on the way meat should be cooked. 5. How do microwaves cook food?
